topic.title: ZeroNet vs IPFS: Some thoughts
topic.body: I have been following ZeroNet progress for some time. I've seen that people have recommended that IPFS is superior. In my experience ZeroNet offers a better out-of-the-box experience. IPFS is too low-level in my opinion, and still requires a useful platform to be built on top to compete with ZeroNet. However, adoption for ZeroNet seems relatively slow. It has improved since I last used it ~3 years ago, but growth seems quite slow. Does anyone else have any opinions regarding this?

1598631792_1DnpB2yFpVwyhA29h2rRsifGVEC1s.body: The world is so bizarre, sometimes I think we are in an episode of Welcome to Nightvale

1598740778_1DLBhCccN3MbM5YmzNS2UfBzDkEZk.body: What has been your general opinion working with Svelte? I've heard the performance is quite good. How is the debug/tooling ecosystem?

1599173288_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: Snowden showed incredible bravery in what he did, at extreme personal cost.

1599488992_17AwNLQUY1CRAb1U6jVJhvVUnyEdN.body: This website is not filling me with confidence, but I cannot explain why . Be careful of random binaries from the internet.
